newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Korea institute proposes investor protection fund.
newsitem.headline: Korea institute proposes investor protection fund.

text.p: The Korea Securities Research Institute proposed on Friday the launch of a fund to protect investors in case of bankruptcy or failure of securities firms, a finance ministry official said.
Korea Securities Research Institute said the fund would be worth 150 billion won within 10 years.

"This prepares for the possibility of a securities house defaulting," the ministry official said, adding that liberalisation of the securities industry and the rising volume of derivaties trade had increased the risks for securities houses.
The finance ministry plans to look into the proposal after more research and public hearings, with its possible implementation next year.
